# ToggleStyleConfiguration

**Structure**

The properties of a toggle instance.

## Declaration

```swift
struct ToggleStyleConfiguration
```

## Overview

When you define a custom toggle style by creating a type that conforms to the [doc://com.apple.SwiftUI/documentation/SwiftUI/ToggleStyle] protocol, you implement the [doc://com.apple.SwiftUI/documentation/SwiftUI/ToggleStyle/makeBody(configuration:)] method. That method takes a `ToggleStyleConfiguration` input that has the information you need to define the behavior and appearance of a [doc://com.apple.SwiftUI/documentation/SwiftUI/Toggle].

The configuration structure’s [doc://com.apple.SwiftUI/documentation/SwiftUI/ToggleStyleConfiguration/label-swift.property] reflects the toggle’s content, which might be the value that you supply to the `label` parameter of the [doc://com.apple.SwiftUI/documentation/SwiftUI/Toggle/init(isOn:label:)] initializer. Alternatively, it could be another view that SwiftUI builds from an initializer that takes a string input, like [doc://com.apple.SwiftUI/documentation/SwiftUI/Toggle/init(_:isOn:)]. In either case, incorporate the label into the toggle’s view to help the user understand what the toggle does. For example, the built-in [doc://com.apple.SwiftUI/documentation/SwiftUI/ToggleStyle/switch] style horizontally stacks the label with the control element.

The structure’s [doc://com.apple.SwiftUI/documentation/SwiftUI/ToggleStyleConfiguration/isOn] property provides a [doc://com.apple.SwiftUI/documentation/SwiftUI/Binding] to the state of the toggle. Adjust the appearance of the toggle based on this value. For example, the built-in [doc://com.apple.SwiftUI/documentation/SwiftUI/ToggleStyle/button] style fills the button’s background when the property is `true`, but leaves the background empty when the property is `false`. Change the value when the user performs an action that’s meant to change the toggle, like the button does when tapped or clicked by the user.

## Getting the label view

- **label**: A view that describes the effect of switching the toggle between states.
- **ToggleStyleConfiguration.Label**: A type-erased label of a toggle.

## Managing the toggle state

- **isMixed**: Whether the [doc://com.apple.SwiftUI/documentation/SwiftUI/Toggle] is currently in a mixed state.
- **isOn**: A binding to a state property that indicates whether the toggle is on.
- **$isOn**

## Styling toggles

- **toggleStyle(_:)**: Sets the style for toggles in a view hierarchy.
- **ToggleStyle**: The appearance and behavior of a toggle.
